result.execSummary:
The defendant Sirvonta R Shine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other sentence.  Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.  Court grants 2 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost/Surcharge.

No use or possession of controlled substances or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 3.  Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.

See Count 3 for Additional Conditions.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost/Surcharge.  Remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sirvonta R Shine

records.addlTxt: Treatment letter filed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sirvonta R Shine in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #3, and a no-contest plea to count #4. Court finds the Defendant guilty of count #3 and count #4.

State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty McMahon makes sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. 

COUNT #3:
Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
2 days credit if revoked

Term of Probation: 12 MONTHS
Concurrent to any other sentence
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $243.00 
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail to costs and surcharge

CONDITION TIME: 30, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

COUNT#4:
Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation: 12 MONTHS
Concurrent to count #3
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count #3

COSTS:  $243.00 
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail, balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sirvonta R Shine in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  

Defense is requesting a new date for Pleas.
Defense needs time to provide treatment verification to the State.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sirvonta R Shine
Current: 4515 N 84th St, Apt 3, Milwaukee, WI 53225 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2022)
Prior: 5715 W Lincoln Ave #8, West Allis, WI 53219
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court.   
Defendant Sirvonta R Shine did not appear - Defendant not able to appear due to illness.

Defense does have an offer they are willing to accept.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Hearing on April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:43 AM Defendant Sirvonta R Shine in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to time limits for a prelim hearing.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
THE COURT WILL SCHEDULE A STATUS OF COUNSEL DATE WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT SHOULD AN ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL BE FILED THAT DATE WILL COME OFF.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:21 PM Defendant Sirvonta R Shine in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jensen appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
